meanings.definition: The action of forbidding something, especially by law.
meanings.sent1: The prohibition of cell phones in class helps students focus on learning.
meanings.sent2: The government passed a prohibition on smoking in public places.
meanings.sent3: During the prohibition of sugary snacks, the kids tried to sneak cookies into the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her strict prohibition on late-night TV watching made her the 'no-fun' parent.
meanings.sent5: The prohibition on using cheat sheets during the exam made the students study harder.

meanings.definition: A law or regulation that forbids something.
meanings.sent1: The new prohibition on plastic bags aims to reduce environmental pollution.
meanings.sent2: The city council imposed a prohibition on loud music after 10 pm.
meanings.sent3: The prohibition on eating in the library led to some creative hiding spots for snacks.
meanings.sent4: His strict prohibition on borrowing his tools made him unpopular with his neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The prohibition on parking in front of the fire hydrant is clearly marked with a red curb.
